Welcome to the TAU Group

We are a dynamic research group in the Department of Visualization at the Texas A&M University. Our group develops and utilizes machine learning algorithms and tools to carry out simulations, data analytics, and visualization on both parallel and distributed computing systems.

Previous Next

Our specific areas of interest include:

  • Digital Twin, Data Curation, Internet of Things (IoT)
  • Scientific Machine Learning (SciML), Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL)
  • Scientific Visualization (SciViz), 3D Modeling, VR/AR
  • Geospatial Analysis, Signal Processing
  • Natural Language Processing (NLP)

We are grateful for funding from Texas A&M University, NSF, the NIST, and the LYRASIS Catalyst Fund.

News

02/17/2022 [EVENT]

Dr. Jian Tao helped create the Data Science Ambassador Scholarship Program that solicits applications from Texas A&M Ph.D. students who wish to serve as representatives for TAMIDS and champions for Data Science literacy in their departments.

02/15/2022 [EVENT]

Dr. Jian Tao helped organize the 2022 Student Data Science Competition hosted by Texas A&M Institute of Data Science.

02/14/2022 [GRANT]

Dr. Jian Tao and Andre Thomas received a grant through the TAMIDS Course Development Program to develop a course on digital twins.

02/08/2022 [EVENT]

Dr. Jian Tao hosted the Online Digital Twin Workshop to help identify and bring together members of the academic community at Texas A&M who are interested in studying and building digital twins.
